frameDefinitions: A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.
This frame concerns people's knowledge or skill in certain domains.
A Cause, animate or inanimate, causes a process, the Effect, to begin.
An Entity represents some Phenomenon through its existence and/or defining characteristics.
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
frameExamples: Avoid allowing light to <t>shine</t> into neighbors' gardens.
FE Layer-1: He is an <t>experienced</t> programmer.
The murder of Sergei Kirov <t>set off</t> a chain of events that culminated in the Great Terror of the 1930s.
A bear <t>symbolizes</t> strength in some cultures.
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
listRoleDefinitions: The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
This role identifies the entity at the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Beam</fen> originates.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.
The light that travels from a <fen>Source</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Path</fen> refers to where the <fen>Beam</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Beam</fen> travels by.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> ends up in.
The person whose expertise is assessed.
<fen>Skill</fen> identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s talent or ability to do things with one's hand or body.
The area of knowledge (as opposed to a practical skill) in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> 's experience is assessed.
A  product of behavior that shows the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s skill or lack of skill.

This frame element can only occur in place of a skill expression. It refers to the prototypical patient in an action involving the Protagonist. For instance, in the following sentence  the children are experts at some (contextually given) action such as rolling the hoops.

<fex name='Protagonist'>Some children</fex> <m>were</m> <fex name='Degree'>quite</fex> <t>expert</t> <fex name='Focal_participant'>with wooden hoops</fex>.
This frame element denotes a role in which the protagonist has developed his expertise.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has the expertise.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the process that the <fen>Cause</fen> initiates.
This role is for the <fen>Time</fen>  when causing to start occurs
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Effect</fen> occurs.
The event, idea, or emotion evoked by the <fen>Entity</fen>.
An object that has some association with a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The time period in which the representing occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the representing event occurs.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
listRoleExamples: Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
<fex>Sunlight</fex> gleamed from the water of the bay.
A skillful <fex>advertising campaign</fex> persuaded voters that his opponent was soft on crime.
His prowess <fex>as a surgeon</fex> is impressive.
Few things spark <fex>the wrath of the British</fex> like food additives.
<fex>In Obscurania</fex>, the release of the movie sparked protests.
She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the first half of the thirteenth century
Abu'l Walīd Muhammad Ibn Ahmad Ibn Muhammad IbnRushd
the end of the fifteenth century
the end of the twelfth century to the end of the sixteenth
the end of the twelfth to the end of the sixteenth century
the first half of the fourteenthcentury
a Turk, Mustafā Ibn Yūsuf al-Bursawī
thelatter half of the thirteenth century
An Introduction to the Study of Science"
